passages.text: Friday, 29 August 2025
Top Call | Company | Industry | Strategy & E | Global | Key Rating and Target Price Changes
Click here to type optional introductory text

With the September 7 PBA elections and October mid- term election getting closer, the risk aversion has materially increased despite available polls suggesting the government may increase their seats in the midterms, although polls are also getting narrower specially at the Province of Buenos Aires (PBA). We focus our monthly on how the market has performed in previous elections cycles, and the potential scenarios.
Andrés Cardona | Brian Flores, CFA | Renata Cabral | Ernesto Revilla | Ivan Riveros, CFA

We are updating estimates after 2Q for STNE and PAGS, increasing STNE TP to US \(18.0\) (from US \(17.0\) ) and decreasing PAGS TP to US \(9.0\) (from US \(10.0\) ). We are introducing a downside Catalyst Watch on PAGS, due to weak op. expectations for 3Q. However, we see an attractive div yield of \(18\%\) for the next 12M, implying total upside potential of \(23\%\) . STNE remains our preference, as we believe it has a clearer growth trajectory in the next years, though we continue to be (conservatively) below its '27 guidance. Also, STNE should deliver a \(10\%\) div yield in the next 12 months, partly due to business divestment, supporting the \(23\%\) ETR.
Gustavo Schroden | Arnon Shirazi, CFA | Brian Flores, CFA

We hosted Citi's Martijn Wilkie and Vivek Midha to get updates on WEG's European peers. Companies are benefiting from hyperscaler investment in data centers, which has kept demand for medium- voltage equipment and transformers strong. Supply constraints and long lead times in transformers have also boosted pricing and margins. Data centers are straining grid capacity, forcing operators to build their own gas- fired power plants, often with smaller turbines to meet urgent needs. This "direct generation" trend is seen as temporary until utilities expand the grid, thus allowing the electrification supercycle underpinnings to remain intact. Currently, WEG is trading at \(36\%\) P/E discount to global peers, the lowest in 15

Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

years vs. a historical \(30\%\) premium. While Weg will have tough revenue comps through 1Q26, we expect ST margin expansion on the back of a better product mix and a healthy environment for the T&D business, especially in North America.
Andre Mazini, CFA | Kiepher Kennedy | Piero Trotta

Cars resale uncertainties remain high, with risks of credit deterioration and prices not yet reflecting the full IPI taxation impact. Even so, our sentiment is that Localiza's de- rating has gone too far, pricing excessive risks at the current valuation. Affordability, rational competition and stronger seasonality seem supportive of healthy rental demand in the coming quarters, Seminovos margins sound less at risk with the company's cautious depreciation (even with car resale uncertainties), and cost efficiency efforts are tailwinds for operational results. Even as our target price drops from \(\mathbb{R}\Phi 43\) to \(\mathbb{R}\Phi 41.50\) /share on revised DCF, the stock trading at \(8.3xP / E\) 2026E looks too compelling, offering one of the best upside asymmetries among our Latin Transports coverage. We reiterate our Buy rating.

We joined Banco Macro's 2Q25 conference call, where management reiterated the \(8 - 10\%\) real ROE guidance for 2025, while loan growth should remain close to \(- 60\% \text{YoY}\) in real terms and deposits closer to \(30\% \text{YoY}\) and capital close to \(- 28.75\%\) . Higher deposit costs compressed margins in the short term, but management remains comfortable with the credit portfolio's performance and is not seeing any material deterioration in asset quality.
Brian Flores, CFA | Gustavo Schroden | Arnon Shirazi, CFA

We joined Banco Hipotecario's conference call. Management expects more clarity on the macro front to update guidance after 3Q25 results, mostly due to the high reserve requirements and the changing nature of recent policies. Previously, the bank had worked with real loan growth of \(- 50\% \text{YoY}\) and deposits growth of \(- 20 - 30\%\) , which could change depending on the economic and market environment. Moreover, the tax rate should normalize as the benefit of tax credits wears off by 3Q25.
Brian Flores, CFA | Gustavo Schroden | Arnon Shirazi, CFA
Brazil Retail = Findings for Jul and Preliminary Q3 Forecast: Pharma Stands Out; Food Accelerates

This report provides a broad view on Brazilian Retail with data from various providers, including Brazil's Retail Institute IDV, Stone, and Nielsen (strictly Food/Pharma). In collaboration with Research Innovation Lab, we also analyse website traffic and app usage from SimilarWeb/SensorTower. For Jul, IDV anticipates an acceleration for general retail with weighted nominal sales growth of \(+5.5\%\) (from \(2.9\%\) in Jun), driven by pharma and wholesale food/retail food. For pharma, IDV forecasts sales to remain growing mid- teens through Aug and accelerate in Sep. For wholesale food, IDV's forecast for Jul of \(+10\%\) matches Nielsen's latest print for Jul ( \(- 11\%\) for C&C, from \(7\%\) in Jun). While IDV expects consistent performance from Apparel ( \(+6\%\) in Jul, from \(+7\%\) in Aug), we note IDV expects an acceleration for the sector through Q3, especially in Sep. This is consistent with preliminary qualitative feedback from apparel retailers (i.e. baseline easier for second half of Q3).
João Pedro Soares | Leandro Bastos, CFA
Brazil Steel - GECEX Antidumping Decision on Metal Sheets and China Output Cap Discussions: Potential Support for Brazilian Seelmakers

According to recent reports, GECEX has approved a definitive five- year antidumping duty on carbon steel metal sheets imported from China. This directly benefits CSN, for whom the product accounts for around \(10\%\) of steel revenues. A provisional measure had been imposed for six months (from Oct 2024 to Apr 2025), but import penetration in this segment had recently reached back to 40- 50%, according to the company. While the decision is product- specific, it may signal a broader willingness by the government to pursue additional trade protection—a view we outlined in our recent Citi steel coverage reports (CSN/CMIN, USIM, GGBR).
Gabriel Barra | Stefan Weskott, CFA | Alexander Hacking, CFA

According to newswires (g1, 08/28/2025), on Thursday morning a national task force with about 1,400 agents served search, seizure and arrest warrants in eight states of the country to break up a billionaire criminal scheme in the Fuel sector. The irregularities were identified at various stages of the fuel production and distribution process in the country. From our perspective, this news is in line with our forecast of a greater fight against irregularities in the Fuel Distribution Industry that could support better margins in the sector.

In this week's edition, we take a closer look at July data for the Brazilian credit system, focusing on asset quality. Key takeaways: (1) 90d NPLs for individuals are rising across series; (2) SMEs are seeing a pickup in NPLs, while large companies remain healthy; (3) early NPLs are mostly under control YTD; (4) Early NPLs are increasing, albeit more moderately in recent months; (5) Provisions seem to have an impact due to regulatory changes but have kept the rising trend YTD; and (5) Debt service as \(\%\) of income and indebtedness remain high, but stable.
Gustavo Schroden | Brian Flores, CFA | Arnon Shirazi, CFA

What are the impacts on economic activity from the US tariffs of \(50\%\) on Brazilian products since August 6? In this report we address this question considering the trade/exports channel only. Our results suggest a limited impact of around 0.5p.p. of GDP for a full year, which combined with domestic policy reaction might mean an even smaller effect on activity. Thus, we remain comfortable with our \(2.2\%\) and \(1.8\%\) GDP growth forecasts for 2025 and 2026, respectively.
Leonardo Porto | Paulo Lopes | Thais Ortega

This week's unemployment release for July continued to show tight labor market conditions despite below potential activity. While we don't have a strong view about the discrepancies between labor and activity cyclical conditions or if it reflects a temporary glitch, increased informality after the pandemic might help to explain. In any case, tight labor market conditions besides large minimum wage hikes point to pressures in nominal wages, which are likely limiting the disinflation progress in the services index. Persistent core inflation remains a challenge for further rate cuts during the rest of the year, but the Fed resuming its easing cycle
may incline the balance towards further rate cuts, assuming no ugly surprises in core inflation, in our view.
Julio Cesar Ruiz | Felipe Juncal
In this report, we discuss our expectations for relevant economic indicators to be disclosed in LatAm in the next week.
Ernesto Revilla | Leonardo Porto | Esteban Tamayo | Julio Cesar Ruiz | Paulo Lopes

The NVDA quarter suggests that the US Al boom continues. We remain overweight US equities but had tactically taken profits in our TWSE long ahead of the print. We would add additional equity risk on a seasonal September pull- back. We add USDCLP topside to our radar heading into the Latam election season. We reiterate our paid 1y1y in Japan, in line with BoJ Governor Ueda's Jackson Hole speech. We recently added to both steepeners and USD shorts given rising risks of a more dovish FOMC in case of a Lisa Cook exit. We think continued political risks in France will not impact EUR much but can more easily be positioned for in the equity space.
Adam Pickett | Dirk Willer | Giammarco Miani | Charlie Massy- Collier | Alice Zheng

We saw very little changes to broad positioning during August. Asset allocators remain long equities and underweight USD. Changes were limited mostly to position trimming this month. The bearish USD positioning remained intact despite the greenback's strength. Other consensus underweights are in fixed income; both USTs and JGBs. Overweight positions include EM rates, US real rates, and Gilts while credit remains in relative value mode, underweight US IG and overweight EU high yield. Managers are overweight the commodity complex, with gold a consensus trade; the biggest change on the month was increased energy exposure (from neutral). Consensus FX positions remain; long EUR and EMFX against short USD. Manager disagreement exists in US equities, now neutral, and US HY credit. Most managers with a view are short Japan bonds and IG credit. There continues to be very little to no disagreement in consensus FX views.
Alex Saunders | Nathaniel Rupert | Dirk Willer | Alice Zheng | Adam Pickett

US \(16.6bn\) inflow into equity funds - In the week of 27 August 2025, US \(19.7bn\) of inflow went into bond funds while equity funds had US \(16.6bn\) . Global funds saw US \(5.8bn\) of inflow. US funds also had US \(8.5bn\) of flows coming back in. European funds however were hit by US \(1.2bn\) of net redemptions. In Japan, equity funds saw US \(0.9bn\) of outflow while their Money Market funds saw similarly sized inflows.
Chris Ma | Yue Hin Pong | Chris Montagu | Hong Li

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of 15% or more or 25% or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient

valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "-" and "-" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re- establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short- term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds 15% against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
Any price(s) of instruments mentioned in recommendations are as of the prior day's market close on the primary market for the instrument, unless otherwise stated.

The completion and first dissemination of any recommendations made within this research report are as of the Eastern date- time displayed at the top of the Product. If the Product references views of other analysts then please refer to the price chart or rating history table for the date/time of completion and first dissemination with respect to that view.

Regulations in various jurisdictions require that where a recommendation differs from any of the author's previous recommendations concerning the same financial instrument or issuer that has been published during the preceding 12- month period that the change(s) and the date of that previous recommendation are indicated. For fundamental coverage please refer to the price chart or rating change history within this disclosure appendix or the issuer disclosure summary at https://www.citvlicocity.com/cvr/ppublic/citi_research_disclosures.

Citi Research has implemented policies for identifying, considering and managing potential conflicts of interest arising as a result of publication or distribution of investment research. A description of these policies can be found at https://www.citvlicocity.com/cvr/ppublic/citi_research_disclosures.

The proportion of all Citi Research research recommendations that were the equivalent to "Buy", "Hold", "Sell" at the end of each quarter over the prior 12 months (with the % of these that had received investment firm services from Citi in the prior 12 months shown in brackets) is as follows: Q2 2025 Buy 33% (63%), Hold 44% (51%), Sell 23% (49%), RV 0.4% (86%); Q1 2025 Buy 33% (63%), Hold 44% (51%), Sell 23% (49%), RV 0.5% (87%); Q4 2024 Buy 32% (64%), Hold 44% (52%), Sell 23% (44%), RV 0.4% (92%); Q3 2024 Buy 33% (61%), Hold 44% (52%), Sell 23% (49%), RV 0.4% (80%). For the purposes of disclosing recommendations other than for equity (whose definitions can be found in the corresponding disclosure sections), "Buy" means a positive directional trade idea; "Sell" means a negative directional trade idea; and "Relative Value" means any trade idea which does not have a clear direction to the investment strategy.

European regulations require a 5 year price history when past performance of a security is referenced. CitiVelocity's Charting Tool (https://www.citvlicocity.com/cv2/#go/CHARTING_3_Equities) provides the facility to create customisable price charts including a five year option. This tool can be found in the Data & Analytics section under any of the asset class menus in CitiVelocity (https://www.citvlicocity.com/). For further information contact CitiVelocity support (https://www.citvlicocity.com/cv2/go/CLIENT_SUPPORT). The source for all referenced prices, unless otherwise stated, is DataCentral, which sources price information from Thomson Reuters. Past performance is not a guarantee or reliable indicator of future results. Forecasts are not a guarantee or reliable indicator of future performance.

Citi Research broadly and simultaneously disseminates its research content to the Firm's institutional and retail clients via the Firm's proprietary electronic distribution platforms (e.g., Citi Velocity and various Global Wealth platforms). As a convenience, certain, but not all, research content may be distributed through third party aggregators. Clients may receive published research reports by email, on a discretionary basis, and only after such research content has been broadly disseminated. Certain research is made available only to institutional investors to satisfy regulatory requirements. The level and types of services provided by Citi Research analysts to clients may vary depending on various factors such as the client's individual preferences as to the frequency and manner of receiving communications from analysts, the client's risk profile and investment focus and perspective (e.g. market- wide, sector specific, long term, short- term etc.), the size and scope of the overall client relationship with the Firm and legal and regulatory constraints.

Pursuant to Comissão de Valores Mobiliários Resolução 20 and ASIC Regulatory Guide 264, Citi is required to disclose whether a Citi related company or business has a commercial relationship with the subject company. Considering that Citi operates multiple businesses in more than 100 countries around the world, it is likely that Citi has a commercial relationship with the subject company.

For non- fundamental research reports, Citi Research may not provide regular updates to the views, recommendations and facts included in the reports. Notwithstanding that Citi Research

maintains coverage on, makes recommendations concerning or discusses issuers, Citi Research may be periodically restricted from referencing certain issuers due to legal or policy reasons. Where a component of a published trade idea is subject to a restriction, the trade idea will be removed from any list of open trade ideas included in the Product. Citi Research may provide different research products and services to different classes of customers (for example, based upon long- term or short- term investment horizons) that may lead to differing conclusions or recommendations that could impact the price of a security contrary to the recommendations in the alternative research product, provided that each is consistent with the rating system for each respective product.

Card Insights. Where this report references Card Insights data, Card Insights consists of selected data from a subset of Citi's proprietary credit card transactions. Such data has undergone rigorous security protocols to keep all customer information confidential and secure; the data is highly aggregated and anonymized so that all unique customer identifiable information is removed from the data prior to receipt by the report's author or distribution to external parties. This data should be considered in the context of other economic indicators and publicly available information. Further, the selected data represents only a subset of Citi's proprietary credit card transactions due to the selection methodology or other limitations and should not be considered as indicative or predictive of the past or future financial performance of Citi or its credit card business.
